title: 105_s243
content: The Act may be cited as the "Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act" and it involves the temporary reinstatement of airport and airway trust fund taxes. The fuel tax rate specified in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to 4.3 cents per gallon after December 31, 1996, and before the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act, and after September 29, 1997. The fuel tax rate in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to 4.3 cents per gallon after December 31, 1996, and before the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act, and after September 29, 1997. The fuel tax rate in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to 4.3 cents per gallon after December 31, 1996, and before the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act, and after September 29, 1997. Clause (i) of subsection (a)(2)(A) shall be 4.3 cents per gallon during specific periods. Section 4081(d)(3) and Section 4041(c)(5) of the Code are also affected. The fuel tax rate in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to 4.3 cents per gallon after December 31, 1996, and before the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act, and after September 29, 1997. Section 4081(d)(3) is repealed, and Section 4041(c)(5) is amended for specific tax periods. The period for certain provisions is from August 27, 1996, to December 31, 1996, and from 7 days after the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act to September 29, 1997. Ticket taxes are amended to apply to transportation starting 7 days after the Act's enactment. The Ticket Taxes sections are amended to apply to transportation starting 7 days after the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act, and before September 30, 1997. Amendments are made to transfer funds to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund until September 30, 1997. The Ticket Taxes sections are amended to apply to transportation starting 7 days after the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act, and before September 30, 1997. Amendments are made to transfer funds to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund until September 30, 1997. Amendments also include changing the dates for the Airport and Airway Trust Fund financing rate to zero for taxes imposed after December 31, 1996. The Airport and Airway Trust Fund financing rate will be zero for taxes imposed after December 31, 1996, and before 7 calendar days after the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act, as well as for taxes imposed after September 29, 1997. The enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act imposed a floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon on aviation fuel held before the tax-increase date. On the tax-increase date described in the Revenue Code of 1986, a floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon is imposed on aviation fuel held by any person. The liability for the tax applies to those holding the fuel on that date, and the payment method is determined by the Secretary. The tax imposed on aviation fuel on a tax-increase date must be paid as prescribed by the Secretary by the first day of the 7th month after the date. The term "the Code" refers to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The tax on aviation fuel must be paid by the first day of the 7th month after the tax-increase date. Definitions include "the Code" as the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, "tax-increase date" as 7 days after enactment, and "aviation fuel" as defined in section 4093 of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 defines terms such as "tax-increase date" as 7 days after enactment, "aviation fuel" as per section 4093 of the Code, and "held by a person" as passing title to that person. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Treasury. Aviation fuel is considered held by a person if title has passed to them. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Treasury. The tax does not apply to aviation fuel held exclusively for certain uses on the tax-increase date. On the tax-increase date, the tax on aviation fuel does not apply if it is held exclusively for certain uses for which a credit or refund is allowable. No tax is imposed on aviation fuel held by a person if the aggregate amount does not exceed a certain limit. On the tax-increase date, no tax is imposed on aviation fuel held by a person if the aggregate amount does not exceed 2,000 gallons, provided the necessary information is submitted to the Secretary. On the tax-increase date, no tax is imposed on aviation fuel held by a person if the aggregate amount does not exceed 2,000 gallons, and the necessary information is submitted to the Secretary as required. Fuel exempt from tax under paragraph (4) is not considered, and controlled groups are defined for this purpose. Exempt fuel is not included in the tax calculation for aviation fuel held by a person on the tax-increase date. Controlled groups are treated as one group for tax purposes. For tax purposes, all persons in a controlled group are treated as one group, as defined by section 1563 of the Code. The term "controlled group" is defined by section 1563 of the Code, with the phrase "more than 50 percent" replacing "at least 80 percent" in certain instances. Principles similar to those for incorporated persons apply to nonincorporated persons under common control. The term "controlled group" is defined by section 1563 of the Code, with the phrase "at least 80 percent" being replaced by "more than 50 percent" in certain cases. Similar principles apply to nonincorporated persons under common control. Regulations may be prescribed by the Secretary for groups of persons under common control where one or more are not corporations. All relevant provisions of law, including penalties, apply to the taxes imposed. The term "controlled group" is defined by section 1563 of the Code, with regulations prescribed by the Secretary for groups of persons under common control where one or more are not corporations. All relevant provisions of law, including penalties, apply to the taxes imposed by section 4091 of the Code. The amendments made by this section take effect 7 days after the date of enactment of this Act. The taxes imposed by sections 4261 and 4271 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 do not apply to amounts paid for taxable transportation. The taxes on transportation tickets purchased during the lapse period do not apply after December 31, 1996, and before the effective date of the amendments made by this section. The amendment to Section 9502(b) of the Code states that any tax amount received in the Treasury after specific dates shall be treated as received the day before such date, regardless of when it was actually received. This amendment applies to amounts received after December 31, 1995.
